title: Information and Reformation in KM Systems: Big Data and Strategic Decision-Making
research_description: This article develops a theoretical framework for integrating big data into Knowledge Management (KM) systems to enhance strategic decision-making. The paper highlights how organizations can use advanced analytics to reform KM systems and improve data-based decisions in both public and private sectors, combining empirical case studies with literature analysis.
research_results: The study identifies four types of data-based decision-making and proposes a conceptual model to reform KM systems to better incorporate big data. The framework is designed to handle complex, structured, and unstructured data while enabling strategic decision-making in organizations.
future_research: Future research could explore empirical applications of the proposed framework in various industries and assess the role of advanced analytics in improving KM systems' adaptability to big data.
